name: Ronald K. BARTO et al., Appellees, v. John A. FELIX, Appellant

judges: Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN and FLAHERTY, JJ.
parties: Ronald K. BARTO et al., Appellees, v. John A. FELIX, Appellant.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM:
The petition for allowance of appeal having been improvidently granted, the appeal is dismissed.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Gary M. Lightman, Barry J. Peffley, Harrisburg, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
409 A.2d 857
Ronald K. BARTO et al., Appellees, v. John A. FELIX, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Dec. 11, 1979.
Decided Jan. 18, 1980.
Peter Campana, Williamsport, for appellant.
Gary M. Lightman, Barry J. Peffley, Harrisburg, for appellees.
Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN and FLAHERTY, JJ.
